## AlLocatorMatrix.setContext() method

Sets the acting context (preferred environment, data residency, location attributes). This acts as a merge against existing context, so the caller can provide only fragmentary information without borking things.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
setContext(context?: AlLocationContext): void;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  context | <code>AlLocationContext</code> |  |

<b>Returns:</b>

`void`
